page.title: 09Wooler-Wishing or Pin Well
page.content: South of Wooler on the road to Earle is Horsdon Hill where the annual cattle and sheep fair used to held. At its foot is the Pin Well.On May Day a procession of people used to march from Wooler to the well and each person would drop a crooked pin into it and made a wish. Overhanging the well is a rock called the King's Chair.Legend has it that a king sat on the rock and directed a legendary battle on the plain below.This area of land is called the Kettles and has given its name to a prehistoric camp which is on the top of the hill.
